meanings.definition: A pneumatic tool used for breaking up concrete or pavement.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker used a jackhammer to break the concrete.
meanings.sent2: The jackhammers were loud but effective in demolishing the old sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The noisy jackhammers woke up the entire neighborhood early in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic pounding of the jackhammers echoed through the city streets.
meanings.sent5: The jackhammers chipped away at the solid pavement, creating a cloud of dust.

meanings.definition: To use a jackhammer to break up concrete.
meanings.sent1: He jackhammers the ground to make way for the new foundation.
meanings.sent2: They jackhammered the road to repair the damaged section.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she could jackhammer through the wall if she wanted to.
meanings.sent4: The idea of having to jackhammer through the entire floor seemed daunting.
meanings.sent5: The workers jackhammered tirelessly under the scorching sun to finish the task.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a jackhammer.
meanings.sent1: The constant jackhammer noise could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent2: The street echoed with the loud jackhammers during the construction work.
meanings.sent3: The annoying jackhammer sound became a background melody to the day.
meanings.sent4: The jackhammer noise pierced through the air, disrupting the peace of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The sharp, metallic clang of the jackhammers filled the air with industrial music.
